reviewText: Israel isn't the subject but rather is the object that God uses to express his commitment to keeping his word, through the bible God keeps his word to all bond and free, rich and poor, great and unknown people and to religious and non believers alike. The point is that as  Matthew 5:17-20 (KJV) says17  Think not that I am come to destroy the law, or the prophets: I am not come to destroy, but to fulfill.18  For verily I say unto you, Till heaven and earth pass, one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law, till all be fulfilled.19  Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall do and teach them, the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.20  For I say unto you, That except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven.
Title: Against All Odds - Feature Film

reviewText: This movie/DVD provides an interesting documentary of some significant events that took place during the period concerning Israel, and therefore the entire world. Some miracles were described and every miracle of God is worthy of publicity. However, I didn't find the movie quite as good as others described it, I didn't find the portrayal of the miracles was very well done. However I would recommend the DVD to anyone interested in the things of God, but only partly for the miracles.
Title: Against All Odds - Feature Film

reviewText: what a awesome story. everyone should see this. only once in a lifetime can a story like this be told
Title: Against All Odds - Feature Film

reviewText: This enthralling, educational and inspiring film is vital viewing for anyone with any interest in Israel or the Middle East conflict.Whatever your faith and whether you are religious or not this docudrama will certainly make a case for believing with solid evidence thatinexplicable phenomena, which can only be described as miracles, have worked in Israel's favour to ensure Israel's survival and often to save the lives of her people.The presenter of this series makes the point that West Point military academy does not study the Arab-Israeli wars because they simply do not make sense from any logical or military science point of view.Events and real life narratives covered her includeThe miracle of the British capture of Michmash in 1917 against overwhelming odds and a vastly larger Turkish force.The commandos that captured East Jerusalem and the Western Wall during the Six Day War and how all Arab resistance crumbled as they entered. An old Arab man even appeared and willingly and happily opened up the Green Gate to the Temple Mount for them with the only key there was.The miraculous survival of Avigdor Kahalani during the Yom Kippur War after his tank was destroyed by Syrian fire.The survival of Israeli spy in Lebanon Shula Cohen after being tortured to near death by Syrian police.The rescue at Entebbe in 1976 , where despite tight security by the Ugandan forces of Idi Amin and the German and Arab terrorists holding the hostages, the Israeli commandos where able to miraculously land undetected and enter and rescue the Jewish hostages.Interviews, real footage and excellent recreations with brilliant acting and background make this compelling as well as inpiring and educational.
Title: Against All Odds - Feature Film

reviewText: This is very inspiration how God protects the Israeli army in battles with very formidable foes.  It is the right length.
Title: Against All Odds - Feature Film

reviewText: You get 6 dvds and some very fascinating stories about Israel.The transfer is a 4 out of 5.My biggest beef is the episodes were a tad bit slow and certain episodes repeated theirselves quite often.By all means buy them,but at the right price....
Title: Against All Odds - Feature Film

reviewText: Great History. Great compilation, great editing, great collection of real clips and narration. This DVD is a collector's edition.Thanks to AMAZON.
Title: Against All Odds - Feature Film

reviewText: This documentary of the history of the war in Israel greatly explained the tremendous difficulty the Jewish people have faced as they returned to their land and how miraculously God intervened on their behalf.  A great read!
Title: Against All Odds - Feature Film

reviewText: The story begins with a Jewish American investigative reporter named Michael Greenspan. He tells his own story and narrates the stories of Israel using old film footage, real interviews, and story reenactments. I've heard some of the amazing stories of Israel like the wars of 1948 (war of independence), 1967 (6 day war), and 1973 (The Yom Kippur War). In each of these wars, almost every surrounding Arabic country united together and sent massive military forces into Israel to wipe them off the face of the earth, yet Israel somehow survived. All of these wars are beyond belief and proof of present day miracles. God's hand is definitely upon on Israel.When this film talks about The Yom Kippur War, I am reminded how important this war was to the history of the US. This war was the first time the US backed Israel with significant military help and kept Israel from the brink of elimination. This story reminded me of the promise to Abraham where God said He would bless those who bless him (the nation of Israel) and curse those who cruse him (the nation of Israel). This movie does a great job telling the stories of Israel using very personal accounts and stories. I am forever grateful for this movie and for the producers of this film. It has touched my life and really helped me understand the stories of Israel.
Title: Against All Odds - Feature Film
